title: TekSavvy disconnection issues (Southern Ontario, GTA)
body:
Getting periodically disconnected, for up to 1 to 5 minutes, occasionally happening up to 4, 5 times an hour. This is an issue that all of my TekSavvy friends have. It has been occurring since the past week. We all have the disconnects at the same time, ONLY with League, and are wondering if it is possible for you to inquire on this issue further.

Here's a link to the timeouts when I run a ping test using command prompt:

https://gyazo.com/25f8387a306a75a3b36c3516e8063510

If there's anything else I can help you guys get, such as logs or anything, feel free to comment below.

Thanks

replies.body: Im having the same issues, im in the GTA as well, im with Cogeco, totally different provider, but same area as all of yous, Ontario, and just today, actually just tonight it started, last 3 games ive been disconnected while playing, i literally had to end task the client from the task manager and restart the client, rest of my internet worked, i could go on my browser etc.. just league stopped working.. i think its the server were all on, has to be, if its all people from ontario....

Im in GTA with Cogeco as well... Yesterday I was keep getting ping spikes up to 10K, but still playable because it was only random ping spikes. Yesterday night and today the game becomes totally unplayable. My ping jumps up and down every second. Cannot even see connected images at all. Feels like reading a comic book. Downloading stuff and playing other games such as Smite, Dota2, Hearthstone are totally fine, just not league :(

Same issue different ISP same location(Southern Ontario). 
I'm guessing some sort of place we're all being routed through is failing.

So ive been playing with my girlfriends and they are with tek savvy as well and we live 30 mins away from each other and while playing in the same game, we both get disconnected at the same time. I live in mississauga  and they live in north york. This confirms that the issue does lie with teksavvy and riot. Ive been getting this issue a lot but have always thought it was my router or even just my internet. However i just recently played a game where the lag spike and brief disconnect has caused us to understand that this issue is beyond our control.


I hope this issue can be resolved. ..or theres a how to fix it tutorial. ...because im about to switch service providers. ..

I am seeing a small increase in the number of tickets from TekSavvy users. Hard to say for sure yet whether or not it'd be considered a widespread ISP issue, but can you go ahead and [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with your [network logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) so that we can keep tracking this?

Thanks!

I'm with Cogeco Cable and am experiencing this as well. The drop happens somewhere between the Toronto Internet Exchange and 104.160.131.1. I feel like this is where most of the Southern Ontario traffic is getting routed through. I don't know if this helps any but I've also submitted a ticket with the network logs and analysis and process list. Hopefully we can see resolution to this soon as it's still happening and seems to be more severe tonight than previously.

Teksavvy cable user in TO downtown here.

Same issues. Occasional lag spikes and complete disconnection, for no apparent reason.

Internet is fine but it is just LOL client that has this issue.

Oh this might be what's happening to me, I had strange disconnections last game, where my PvP.net client was getting really brief disconnects but it was keeping me out of game for minutes. I could chat with friends from the PvP.net client, via alt-tab. but the game would just stay disconnected for 30secs or more. Also, it is only a problem with my League connection, Teamspeak connection is stable and when I ask if I'm breaking up or sound laggy, other members of the teamspeak say I sound crystal clear.

> [{quoted}](name=G3X787,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aRBcjAcq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-23T06:40:53.362+0000)

Not really possible to chat if you're DC'd from League, because it runs from PVP.net. If you're disconnected from that, it also disconnects you from chat.

Sorry, but I don't think this is the right issue.

maybe not, I'm running a repair of the client now to see if that changes my issue. I also run on TekSavvy in London, Ontario. I usually assume that connection issues are generally on the Rogers end of the connection, as is usually stated in internet outage reports on the support site.
